DOC.brief_title: Medical & Economical Evaluation Fenestrated & Branched Stent-grafts Treat Complex Aortic Aneurysms
DOC.detailed_description: The aim study prospectively compare perioperative mortality severe morbidity cost endovascular versus conventional surgical repair pararenal , supra-renal type 4 THORACO-abdominal aortic aneurysm . The primary goal study demonstrate significant drop 30-day mortality life threaten morbidity endovascular arm study . Our hypothesis , derive literature , average 30-days mortality 3 % endovascular repair 10 % open surgery justifies design prospective study endovascular therapy ( 250 patient ( amendment ) treat 8 University hospital significant experience technique ) open repair ( 660 similar patient analyzed form national database MOH ) . In-hospital morbidity similarly expect low endovascular group . We also wish demonstrate endovascular repair represent significant over-cost , compare open repair . The cost implantable medical device ( IMD ) , follow-up screening , eventual repeat intervention compensate reduced stay intensive care unit ICU , reduce in-hospital length stay .
DOC.criteria: The following anatomical inclusion criterion must meet : Absence significant angulation ( < 60Â° ) aorta iliac artery Absence tight stenosis ( > 70 % ) one target artery ( renal visceral artery perfuse side hole stentgraft ) Diameter target artery 5 mm Iliac femoral artery allow insertion delivery system ( > 7 mm ) suitable insertion access conduit Limited expect life expectancy Emergency case Refuse participate study
